column4: my ubuntu 7.10 doezsnt seem to be using my swap partiton at all. system mon say  0 of o used. i have a swap partion . maybe during install it didnt get set to mount? is there a way to fix this ? my swap is sda2
it isn't using it, no need
do swapon -s
mine gets not used also
ok, but the system monitor says 0 of 0 being used. ok mabey ,no need
swapon -s will tell you if it's activated
Swap:            0          0          0
'mounts' all
even thought it's not mounting i guess
swapon -a
swapon: cannot canonicalize /dev/disk/by-uuid/eba9b7b6-6262-406c-a2e0-e947b430fdc3: No such file or directory
swapon: cannot stat /dev/disk/by-uuid/eba9b7b6-6262-406c-a2e0-e947b430fdc3: No such file or directory
don't worry about that, do swapon -s
it is not in fstab
looks like it is in fstab
but uses uuid
swapon -s
Filename                                Type            Size    Used    Priority
ok easy to fix
it's listed by uuid in your fstab apparently and all you have to do is comment it out and copy the line but change the new line to /dev/sdb2 or whichever
or, you could mkswap -v1 /dev/whatever and change the uuid to the correct one
